medical_history.chief_complaint: Bilateral flank pain and abdominal pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient reports mild abdominal pain for months that acutely worsened in the day or two prior to presentation. The abdominal pain is located in the right upper quadrant (RUQ) and epigastrium, accompanied by back pain. The patient also reports nausea and vomiting (non-bloody) on the morning of presentation. The pain is not significantly worse after eating.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Coombs negative hemolytic anemia, hypertension, degenerative disc disease, anxiety, depression, glaucoma.
medical_history.family_history: Mother with history of ulcerative colitis (UC).
